children.subject:
Another TA here and have to say that this class is pretty awesome.

If you are going to be grinding Leetcode for technical interview prep, why not get some units for your efforts and join a community of likeminded peers?
I'm a TA for this class and couldn't recommend more. All of us are willing to support you in whatever way possible and our students from last semester have had really good outcomes.
Yes, we hope to offer it next semester too.
Update: We are allowing time conflict enrollment! You should be able to add it to your schedule.
<md>Can't enroll this semester because of scheduling issues, will this decal be offered next semester?</md>
Nope! Not this semester.
is synchronous attendance to lectures required and graded?
Yes to both! It is fully remote/online this semester and we plan to offer the decal in future semesters.
How will the discussion portion of the class (second half) work remotely?

Just like normal CS discussion. In the last 45 minutes of the class we will be opening breakout rooms (discussion sections) within the main zoom. In the breakout rooms, the discussion TA will introduce a problem, give students some time to try the problem, and then discuss the solution with their section.
Thanks for offering this - it looks wonderful! Is the Decal available fully remotely, and will it be offered in future semesters?
Yes, the lectures will be posted online.
Will lectures be posted online again this semester? I can’t make the time commitment but it would be really helpful to get access to your lectures :D
Not really imo
If I've already taken this class, does it make sense to take it again? To force myself to do LC prep?
dw they're not that bad
I signed up for the class! Thank you for providing it this semester (especially online due to time conflicts :D). I'm very scared about these interviews.
Same :)
We are unsure at the moment... looking into it now. Will update this thread when we have more info.
I would really appreciate it if the class was expanded to allow for the waitlist. Especially since it's entirely online, I hope course staff will considering allowing it. Thanks :)
Double that! didn't realize some of the stuff could be done asynch and passed up on it when there was room due to a scheduling conflict
We'll definitely try to get it expanded!
pleeeease I just added and am at #86, thought that the schedule conflict would mess me up.
I'm an international student and unfortunately have last priority haha so I would LOVE if the capacity could be expanded!

Please expand the class as it is online. I am currently on the waitlist and the reason I didn't sign up earlier was I didn't know about this Decal course. Please expand and let the waitlist be part of this program. Thanks!
please please please expand the class if possible—I'd really like to take the course this semester!
Any updates on expansion?
They posted that they’d try to get info on expansion to us by the end of the week
update: @15569_f19. We will be expanding the class to 500 students.
Hi, will this class be expanded? I'm currently in position number 10 on the waitlist and I would really love to get in :) Thanks!
The class will have 1.5 hours of lecture (on Tuesday) and 2 required HW problems every week (which should take ~ 10-30 minutes each).
How rigorous and time-consuming is this class? Is it doable along with CS 70, Data 8, and 2 other breadths? (I have taken 61A and 61B)
Yes, just like normal classes.
We can drop decals like any other courses, right?
"You can enroll on CalCentral with Class Number: 33506" --> means you got in right?
Sorry I meant by when will we know if the class will expand to accommodate the waitlisted students. (#58 on the waitlist :( )
update: @15569_f19. We will be expanding to 500 students.
When will we know if we got in or not?
update: @15569_f19. We will be expanding to 500 students.
I've been waiting forever for this but only just realised that the class had been open for fall 2021 since a few days ago. I'm at waitlist #137. Is there any chance I can get in this semester?
The course staff would like to expand. We are working with the department to see if it is possible. I will try to get an update for everyone by mid-week end of week.
Update: @15569_f19. We will be expanding to 500 students.
I know we must seem unrelenting, but I was wondering if there was any update on if the class would be expandable

Oh, Jesus Christ, how come I found this DeCal so late!! I know the chance will be very tiny but I hope I can join too. I am an EECS student but I do concurrent enrollment this semester due to my student visa issue. I just submitted my application via CalCentral & really hope I can join.
All DeCals start next week!
Hi, I'm an enrolled student in this course. Is the first class tonight? I didn't receive a Zoom link or anything by email yet...
We will add everyone to the piazza this week.
Thanks!
Has the piazza for this class been set up? I am trying to enroll in the piazza but it is giving me an error. Thanks!
I'm in the exact same situation, and would like this as well!

Seeing there is a long waitlist and I am a concurrent enrollment student who can't be even waitlisted directly, I am pretty sure I cannot make it to the class. But I really want to take this class or at least I wish to study the material by myself. Do you have a plan to share zoom links or course material for auditing students?
we will be expanding the class to 500!
The EECS late drop deadline is tonight I think if I'm waitlisted and don't drop the course I will be paying a fee. Is there any update on whether waitlisted people can get in?
yay! so if I'm at 100 on the waitlist, since the current capacity is 350 I will be able to get in, right?

Hi Ahan, I am a Berkeley student but enrolling via Extension this semester. As Extension uses a slightly different way for class enrollment, I did not get the waitlist number. But I submitted my application via CalCentral about 3 days ago. Would you please take a look and approve me? I just need an extra step to get into a class!! Please. Thank you!
@Anon Atom 2, yep!
When will the class be expanded?
UPDATE: Hello all -- excited to let everyone know that we will be expanding the class to 500 students (which is our max capacity).
the EECS dept is backed up a bit at the moment so it hasn't happened yet but we will expand the class to take everyone!

given the new size of class I think I should be able to get into the class, but I am still waitlisted on Calcentral—is it because it's just not showing up on calcentral yet, or is there an issue I don't know about?
We won't be expanding beyond 500. However, there is always the 10% rule. We have no idea how many people will drop.
If my waitlist position is not included in the first 500, is there still any chance of getting into the class?
They post a lot on the discord: https://discord.gg/UfDF2kR9

Yes please join the discord for now. The class should expand very soon to 500 students. The class will start on Tuesday -- we will add everyone to Piazza today (Monday) and we also post on the Discord.
Just joined the waitlist today. Can I please get added on piazza? Also, any chance of getting into the class? (Recruiting senior who needs all the help I can get)

Hi, dear respected instructors and staff,

As you kindly announce that the class will be expanded to 500 students, for those who are on the waitlist still are placed on the waitlist, we have not been added to Piazza and yet we don't have any clue if the class has started or not or how will we be informed? Any updates will help us to understand the process. Much appreciated.

history.content:
Returning in Fall 2021:


Feeling intimidated by all the FAANG interns on LinkedIn? Stressed by the recruiting process and not sure where to get good information? The Introduction to Algorithmic Thinking is the Decal for you! 


Coding interviews often require a skill set that is not fully covered by the undergraduate CS curriculum. Rather than leave students to learn these skills on their own, Introduction to Algorithmic Thinking attempts to bridge the gap between traditional computer science coursework and the industry recruiting process. With mock interviews and practice problems curated by frequency, Introduction to Algorithmic Thinking provides a hands-on and practical approach to learning how to code algorithms commonly seen in software engineering interviews.

The decal will involve lectures, practice problems, mock interviews with peers, and some special speakers (JomaTech, Clément Mihailescu, and Jelani Nelson)! 
Our course staff has received offers from Google, Facebook, Salesforce, Amazon, DE Shaw, Intuit etc. and will hold office hours and be there to help you!

If you're interested, enrollment is open on a first-come, first-serve basis (for 2 units).
You can enroll on CalCentral with Class Number: 33506

Course Syllabus and more info can be found at https://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2021-fall-compsci-198-112-grp-112 and https://leetcode101.com/ (when updated)!

- Leetcode 101 DeCal Staff

UPDATE: @15569_f19. We will be expanding the class to 500 students.
